pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:0.5.eng: 25. The training rule on giving robe-cloth

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.1.eng: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro bhikkhu sāvatthiyaṃ aññatarissā visikhāya piṇḍāya carati. Aññatarāpi bhikkhunī tassā visikhāya piṇḍāya carati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.2.eng: a certain monk was walking for almsfood along a street in Sāvatthī, as was a certain nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.3.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—“gaccha, bhagini, amukasmiṃ okāse bhikkhā diyyatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.3.eng: That monk said to that nun, “Go to such-and-such a place, Sister, and you’ll get alms,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.4.pli: Sāpi kho evamāha—“gacchāyya, amukasmiṃ okāse bhikkhā diyyatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.4.eng: and she said the same to him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.5.eng: And because they met frequently, they became friends.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.6.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saṅghassa cīvaraṃ bhājīyati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.6.eng: Just then robe-cloth belonging to the Sangha was being distributed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.7.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī ovādaṃ gantvā yena so bhikkhu tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṃ bhikkhuṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.7.eng: Then, after going to the instruction, that nun went to that monk and bowed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.8.pli: Ekamantaṃ ṭhitaṃ kho taṃ bhikkhuniṃ so bhikkhu etadavoca—“ ayaṃ me, bhagini, cīvarapaṭivīso; sādiyissasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.8.eng: He then said to her, “Sister, will you accept my share of the robe-cloth?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.10.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu tassā bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ adāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.10.eng: And he gave his robe-cloth to that nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.11.eng: As a consequence, his robes, too, became worn.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.12.pli: Bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavocuṃ—“karohi dāni te, āvuso, cīvaran”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.12.eng: Other monks said to him, “Why don’t you make a robe for yourself?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.13.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.13.eng: And he told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.14.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.15.eng: “How could a monk give robe-cloth to a nun?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ adāsī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.16.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.20.pli: “Aññātako, moghapurisa, aññātikāya na jānāti patirūpaṃ vā appatirūpaṃ vā santaṃ vā asantaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.20.eng: “Foolish man, a man and a woman who are unrelated don’t know what’s appropriate and inappropriate, what’s good and bad, in dealing with each other.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.21.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ dassasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.23.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.23.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.24.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ dadeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.24.1.eng: ‘If a monk gives robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.25.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:1.25.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhikkhū kukkuccāyantā bhikkhunīnaṃ pārivattakaṃ cīvaraṃ na denti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.1.eng: Once this had happened, the monks did not even give robe-cloth to the nuns in exchange, being afraid of wrongdoing.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.2.eng: The nuns complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.3.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā amhākaṃ pārivattakaṃ cīvaraṃ na dassantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.3.eng: “How can they not give us robe-cloth in exchange?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.4.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tāsaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ ujjhāyantīnaṃ khiyyantīnaṃ vipācentīnaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.4.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those nuns

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.6.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.7.eng: “Monks, I allow you to give things in exchange to five kinds of people:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.8.eng: monks, nuns, trainee nuns, novice monks, and novice nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.9.pli: anujānāmi, bhikkhave, imesaṃ pañcannaṃ pārivattakaṃ dātuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.10.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.10.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.11.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ dadeyya, aññatra pārivattakā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.11.1.eng: ‘If a monk gives robe-cloth to an unrelated nun, except in exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.6.pli: mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.6.eng: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back eight generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.6.comm: Sp 1.505: Tattha yāva sattamā pitāmahayugāti pitupitā pitāmaho, pitāmahassa yugaṁ pitāmahayugaṁ, “In this yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means: the father of a father is a grandfather. The generation of a grandfather is called a pitāmahayuga.” So the PaIi phrase yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means “as far as the seventh generation of grandfathers”, that is, eight generations back. This can be counted as follows: (1) one’s grandfather; (2) his father; (3) 2’s father; (4) 3’s father; (5) 4’s father; (6) 5’s father; and (7) 6’s father. This applies to both one’s paternal and maternal grandfathers. This gives a total of 14 ancestors. Anyone who is a descendent of these fourteen is considered a relative. Anyone who is not such a descendent is not regarded as a relative.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.8.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.10.pli: channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ vikappanupagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.10.eng: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be assigned to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.10.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Kd 8:3.1.6. According to Kd 8:21.1.4 the size mentioned here is no smaller than 8 by 4 sugataṅgula, “standard fingerbreadths”. For an explanation of sugataṅgula, the idea of vikappanā, and the rendering of cīvara as “robe-cloth”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.1.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī cīvaraṃ deti, aññatra pārivattakā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.1.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he gives her robe-cloth, except in exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.2.pli: Aññātikāya vematiko cīvaraṃ deti, aññatra pārivattakā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.2.eng: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it, and he gives her robe-cloth, except in exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.3.pli: Aññātikāya ñātikasaññī cīvaraṃ deti, aññatra pārivattakā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.3.eng: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related, and he gives her robe-cloth, except in exchange, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.4.pli: Ekato upasampannāya cīvaraṃ deti, aññatra pārivattakā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.4.eng: If he gives robe-cloth to a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, except in exchange, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.5.eng: If she is related, but he perceives her as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.6.eng: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.2.7.eng: If she is related and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.3.pli: pārivattakaṃ parittena vā vipulaṃ, vipulena vā parittaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.3.eng: if much is exchanged with little or little is exchanged with much;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.4.eng: if the nun takes it on trust;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.4.comm: This refers to a situation where you have an agreement with a close friend that you may take their belongings on trust. The conditions for taking on trust are set out at Kd 8:19.1.5.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.6.eng: if he gives any requisite apart from robe-cloth;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.7.eng: if it is a trainee nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.8.eng: if it is a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.10.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.3.11.eng: The training rule on giving robe-cloth, the fifth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:0.5.eng: 26. The training rule on sewing robes

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī paṭṭo hoti cīvarakammaṃ kātuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Udāyī had become skilled in making robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.3.pli: Aññatarā bhikkhunī yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.3.eng: On one occasion a certain nun went to Udāyī and said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.4.eng: “Venerable, would you please sew me a robe?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī tassā bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ sibbitvā surattaṃ suparikammakataṃ katvā majjhe paṭibhānacittaṃ vuṭṭhāpetvā saṃharitvā nikkhipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.5.eng: He then sewed a robe for that nun, well-dyed and beautifully made, and he drew a picture in the middle of it. He then folded it and put it aside.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.5.comm: “Picture” renders paṭibhānacittaṁ. Sp 2.175: Paṭibhānacittanti attano paṭibhānena katacittaṁ, so kira cīvaraṁ rajitvā tassa majjhe nānāvaṇṇehi vippakatamethunaṁ itthipurisarūpamakāsi, “Paṭibhānacitta: a picture made through one’s own impromptu imagination. After dyeing the robe, he made a multi-colored picture in the middle of a man and a woman having sexual intercourse.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.6.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī yenāyasmā udāyī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.6.eng: Soon afterwards that nun went to Udāyī and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.8.pli: “Handa, bhagini, imaṃ cīvaraṃ yathāsaṃhaṭaṃ haritvā nikkhipitvā yadā bhikkhunisaṅgho ovādaṃ āgacchati tadā imaṃ cīvaraṃ pārupitvā bhikkhunisaṅghassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito āgacchā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.8.eng: “Now, Sister, take this robe as it’s folded and put it aside. When the Sangha of nuns goes to the instruction, then put it on and follow right behind the other nuns.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.9.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī taṃ cīvaraṃ yathāsaṃhaṭaṃ haritvā nikkhipitvā yadā bhikkhunisaṅgho ovādaṃ āgacchati tadā taṃ cīvaraṃ pārupitvā bhikkhunisaṅghassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito āgacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.9.eng: And that nun did just that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.11.pli: “yāva chinnikā imā bhikkhuniyo dhuttikā ahirikāyo, yatra hi nāma cīvare paṭibhānacittaṃ vuṭṭhāpessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.11.eng: “How indecent these nuns are, what shameless scoundrels, in drawing pictures on their robes!”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.15.pli: “Yepi te chinnakā dhuttakā ahirikā tesampi evarūpaṃ na sobheyya, kiṃ pana ayyassa udāyissā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.15.eng: “This sort of work would not even make an indecent, shameless scoundrel look good, let alone Venerable Udāyī.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.16.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.17.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.17.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.18.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ sibbissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.18.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī sew a robe for a nun?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.19.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ sibbasī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.19.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.23.pli: “Aññātako, moghapurisa, aññātikāya na jānāti patirūpaṃ vā appatirūpaṃ vā pāsādikaṃ vā apāsādikaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.23.eng: “Foolish man, a man and a woman who are unrelated don’t know what’s appropriate and inappropriate, what’s inspiring and uninspiring, in dealing with each other.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.24.pli: Kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ sibbissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.24.eng: So how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.26.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.26.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.27.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ sibbeyya vā sibbāpeyya vā, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:1.27.1.eng: ‘If a monk sews a robe for an unrelated nun, or has one sewn, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.6.pli: mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.6.eng: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back eight generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.6.comm: Sp 1.505: Tattha yāva sattamā pitāmahayugāti pitupitā pitāmaho, pitāmahassa yugaṁ pitāmahayugaṁ, “In this yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means: the father of a father is a grandfather. The generation of a grandfather is called a pitāmahayuga.” So the PaIi phrase yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means “as far as the seventh generation of grandfathers”, that is, eight generations back. This can be counted as follows: (1) one’s grandfather; (2) his father; (3) 2’s father; (4) 3’s father; (5) 4’s father; (6) 5’s father; and (7) 6’s father. This applies to both one’s paternal and maternal grandfathers. This gives a total of 14 ancestors. Anyone who is a descendent of these fourteen is considered a relative. Anyone who is not such a descendent is not regarded as a relative.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.8.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.10.eng: one of the six kinds of robes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.10.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Kd 8:3.1.6.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.12.pli: sayaṃ sibbati ārāpathe ārāpathe āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.12.eng: if he sews it himself, then for each stitch he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.14.eng: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.15.pli: Sakiṃ āṇatto bahukampi sibbati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.15.eng: If he only asks once, then even if the other sews a lot, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.1.15.comm: “A lot” renders bahukaṁ. Sp 2.176: Bahukampi sibbatīti sacepi sabbaṁ sūcikammaṁ pariyosāpetvā cīvaraṁ niṭṭhāpeti, ekameva pācittiyaṁ, “Bahukampi sibbati: even if he finishes the robe after completing all the needle work, there is just one offense entailing confession.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.1.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī cīvaraṃ sibbati vā sibbāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.1.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he sews her a robe or has one sewn, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.2.pli: Aññātikāya vematiko cīvaraṃ sibbati vā sibbāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.2.eng: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it, and he sews her a robe or has one sewn, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.3.pli: Aññātikāya ñātikasaññī cīvaraṃ sibbati vā sibbāpeti vā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.3.eng: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related, and he sews her a robe or has one sewn, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.4.pli: Ekatoupasampannāya cīvaraṃ sibbati vā sibbāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.4.eng: If he sews a robe, or has one sewn, for a nun who is fully ordained only on one side, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.5.eng: If she is related, but he perceives her as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.6.eng: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.2.7.eng: If she is related and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.3.3.pli: cīvaraṃ ṭhapetvā aññaṃ parikkhāraṃ sibbati vā sibbāpeti vā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.3.3.eng: if he sews any requisite apart from a robe, or has it sewn;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.3.4.eng: if it is a trainee nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.3.5.eng: if it is a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc26:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on sewing robes, the sixth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six traveled by arrangement with nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.4.pli: “yatheva mayaṃ sapajāpatikā āhiṇḍāma, evamevime samaṇā sakyaputtiyā bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya āhiṇḍantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.4.eng: “Just as we walk about with our wives, so these Sakyan monastics walk about by arrangement with nuns.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.5.eng: The monks heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.6.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.6.eng: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.7.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.7.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six travel by arrangement with the nuns?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhunīhi saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.11.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.13.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.14.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya, antamaso gāmantarampi, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a monk travels by arrangement with a nun, even just to the next inhabited area, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.15.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:1.15.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū ca bhikkhuniyo ca sāketā sāvatthiṃ addhānamaggappaṭipannā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of monks and nuns were traveling from Sāketa to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.2.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo te bhikkhū etadavocuṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.2.eng: The nuns said to the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.4.pli: “Na, bhaginī, kappati bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.4.eng: “Sisters, it’s not allowable for us to travel by arrangement with nuns.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.5.pli: Tumhe vā paṭhamaṃ gacchatha mayaṃ vā gamissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.5.eng: Either you go first, or we will.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.8.pli: Atha kho tāsaṃ bhikkhunīnaṃ pacchā gacchantīnaṃ antarāmagge corā acchindiṃsu ca dūsesuñca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.8.eng: But because the nuns went behind, they were robbed and raped by bandits.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.8.comm: For the rendering of dūsesuṁ as “raped”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.9.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo sāvatthiṃ gantvā bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.9.eng: When they arrived at Sāvatthī, they told the nuns there what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.10.eng: The nuns then told the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.11.eng: who in turn told the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.12.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.12.eng: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.13.pli: “anujānāmi, bhikkhave, satthagamanīye magge sāsaṅkasammate sappaṭibhaye bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.13.eng: “Monks, I allow you to travel by arrangement with a nun if it’s a risky and dangerous road that should be traveled with a group.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.14.pli: Evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.14.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.15.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjeyya, antamaso gāmantarampi, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.15.1.eng: ‘If a monk travels by arrangement with a nun, even just to the next inhabited area, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.16.pli: Tatthāyaṃ samayo. Satthagamanīyo hoti maggo sāsaṅkasammato sappaṭibhayo—ayaṃ tattha samayo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.16.eng: This is the appropriate occasion: the road is considered risky and dangerous and should be traveled with a group.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:2.16.comm: “Group” renders sattha, often translated as “caravan”. Sp-ṭ 1.489: Satthoti jaṅghasattho sakaṭasattho vā, “Sattho: a sattha of travelers on foot or a sattha of carts.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.6.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.10.pli: “gacchāma, bhagini, gacchāmāyya; gacchāmāyya, gacchāma, bhagini; ajja vā hiyyo vā pare vā gacchāmā”ti saṃvidahati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.10.eng: if he makes an arrangement like this: he says, “Let’s go, Sister,” and she replies, “Yes, let’s go, venerable;” or she says, “Let’s go, venerable,” and he replies, “Yes, let’s go, Sister;” or he says, “Let’s go today,” “Let’s go tomorrow,” “Let’s go the day after tomorrow,” then he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.11.eng: Even just to the next inhabited area:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.11.comm: For the rendering of gāma as “inhabited area”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.12.pli: kukkuṭasampāte gāme, gāmantare gāmantare āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.12.eng: when the inhabited areas are a chicken’s flight apart, then for every next inhabited area he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.13.pli: Agāmake araññe, addhayojane addhayojane āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.13.eng: When it is an uninhabited area, a wilderness, then for every six kilometers he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.13.comm: For a discussion of the yojana, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.15.eng: unless it is an appropriate occasion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.16.eng: The road should be traveled with a group:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.17.pli: na sakkā hoti vinā satthena gantuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.17.eng: it is not possible to travel without a group.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.19.pli: tasmiṃ magge corānaṃ niviṭṭhokāso dissati, bhuttokāso dissati, ṭhitokāso dissati, nisinnokāso dissati, nipannokāso dissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.19.eng: a place has been seen along that road where criminals are camping, eating, standing, sitting, or lying down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.21.pli: tasmiṃ magge corehi manussā hatā dissanti, viluttā dissanti, ākoṭitā dissanti, sappaṭibhayaṃ gantvā appaṭibhayaṃ dassetvā uyyojetabbā— “gacchatha, bhaginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.1.21.eng: criminals have been seen along that road, injuring, robbing, or beating people. If they go together thinking it is dangerous, but then see that it is not, the nuns are to be dismissed, “Go, Sisters.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.1.pli: Saṃvidahite saṃvidahitasaññī ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, aññatra samayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.1.eng: If there is an arrangement, and he perceives that there is, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next inhabited area, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.2.pli: Saṃvidahite vematiko ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, aññatra samayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.2.eng: If there is an arrangement, but he is unsure of it, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next inhabited area, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.3.pli: Saṃvidahite, asaṃvidahitasaññī ekaddhānamaggaṃ paṭipajjati, antamaso gāmantarampi, aññatra samayā, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.3.eng: If there is an arrangement, but he does not perceive that there is, and he travels with a nun, even just to the next inhabited area, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.4.pli: Bhikkhu saṃvidahati bhikkhunī na saṃvidahati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.4.eng: If the monk makes an arrangement, but the nun does not express her agreement, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.5.eng: If there is no arrangement, but he perceives that there is, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.6.eng: If there is no arrangement, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.2.7.eng: If there is no arrangement, and he does not perceive that there is, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.2.eng: if it is an appropriate occasion;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.3.eng: if he goes without an arrangement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.4.eng: if the nun has made an arrangement, but he has not expressed his agreement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.5.eng: if they go, but not according to the arrangement;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.8.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc27:3.3.9.eng: The  training rule on arrangements, the seventh, is finished.
